Message.Msg: That's right. Zimmerman didn't get fast enough to his car. He was walking toward his car, not running like gazelle. This is why Martin sitting on top and beating his head against concrete is 100% his, Zimmerman's fault. Next time, when some punk on drugs starts beating the hell out of you, make sure you don't resist. Let him finish his job of making beef steak out of you. Or otherwise, you can end up behind bars till the end of your life. So, if you are white, and the punk is black, you better pick up the lesser of 2 evils. Getting permanent brain injury may not be that bad vs sitting in prison cell until almost retirement age. Interesting dilemma.

Topic.Title: Zimerman says the thug was beating hm up

Message.Msg: "All the evidence you need — all the evidence the cops needed — is right there in the interrogation they did with him three days after the shooting. The only thing more shocking than what Zimmerman says in the clip, which was released on the internet one year ago, is how little it has impressed the bloviating jerks who dominate the coverage of this trial. Why did he follow Martin, a police officer asks. “These assholes, they always get away,” Zimmerman answers. The officer asks, “What’s behind that?” “These people who victimize the neighborhood,” Zimmerman answers. In Zimmerman’s angry mind, without trial or jury, even after he killed him and learned he was a 17-year-old who was legitimately staying in the complex, Martin was an asshole victimizing the neighborhood. The officer gets a little defensive at this point. “There was an arrest a week ago,” he points out, though it is also a gentle reminder that Zimmerman’s fear might be a tad misplaced. He continues, skeptically. "How was he running?" Zimmerman describes it and the officer says, “Sounds like he was running to get away... you jumped out of car to see which way he was running? That’s not fear … it’s going to be a problem.” Then Zimmerman whispers something. “What is that you whispered?” the officer asks. “Fucking what?” “Punks,” Zimmerman says.

Topic.Title: Option Question for Board Members.

Message.Msg: Similarly I bought Jan '15 $10 calls, and they're trading approximately with the stock with some narrowing of the premium due to them going FURTHER into the money. The deeper into the money the less the time premium matters, and the less leverage you get . . . it's a tradeoff.

Topic.Title: Option Question for Board Members.

Message.Msg: Thank you Gora and Fubar. That was very helpful. I started to use options because I was getting margin calls at the worst times. Now with Options I keep less margin (bad for E-Trade) and can hold thru the downdrafts. I look back in hindsight and realize I would have avoided my most financial disaster using options. I held a large position in a company that went Bankrupt. If I held the same position in options I would have only lost the option costs of around 10%. Live and learn I guess. I also learned from this past downturn that I should not be afraid to trade options. Since they are leveraged you can lose a lot very fast as well. This insightful on topic discussion got 6 thumbs down. Go figure on this political board.

Topic.Title: Zimerman says the thug was beating hm up

Message.Msg: Remind me please, what was the reason for Trayvon#$%$ Zimmerman's head against concrete? If Trayvon was running from someone, he would run up to his house where he would be 100% safe, and go on with his life like everyone else. Instead he stopped, spent several minutes on the phone with his girl friend, after that confronted Zimmerman with punch in the nose. He was moving away from his home, not toward safety, but to confront Zimmerman. Was that Zimmerman's fault? Trayvon had nothing on his body pointing out that he was even touched. Always pick up a part of the story you want, like other details are insignificant. Is that how our justice system supposed to work these days?

Message.Title: My neighborhood has a Neighborhood Watch
Message.Msg: What they do is watch. If they see something suspicious, we are not shy. We don't say, "I do not want that stranger to think I am nosy." We go get a good look and ask him where they are going. If the stranger was thinking about committing a crime, they know that someone is watching and can identify him. We don't apologize for keeping our neighborhood safe. That is for pansies.

Message.Title: Screaming republicans on Fox news are a drag says gop rep
Message.Msg: GOP Rep: Republicans Have to Stop Screaming on Fox News Rep. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL): “When you try to talk to the American people, and try to bring our vision, that Reagan vision of a ‘shining city on a hill,’ but you’re doing it screaming on Fox News Channel all the time, screaming and yelling on all these cable news channels and being angry, you’re not drawing Americans to your vision. Instead, what you’re doing is showing anger,”

Message.Title: Martin would be alive if Neighborhood Watch had been followed
Message.Msg: "It should be emphasized to members that they do not possess police powers and they shall not carry weapons or pursue vehicles," the manual states. "Members should never confront suspicious persons who could be armed and dangerous." USAonWatch

Topic.Title: Zimerman says the thug was beating hm up

But I was still in High School, and even without getting suspended for fighting and doing drugs and even without the skipping cl#$%$ to get some Purple Drank with my homies, I certainly wouldn't have considered jumping some clown and beating the hell out of him for hurting my feelings to be appropriate. Topic.Title: Zimerman says the thug was beating hm up

Message.Msg: I think Yahoo will actually allow me to post this URL under their new rules . . . http://news.yahoo.com/not-guilty-beyond-reasonable-doubt-070000611.html You who think Zimmerman guilty would do well to read it and try to answer ANY of the questions posed as to the physical evidence supporting in its entirety Zimmerman's story. I grew up in a law enforcement household, and before I was 15 I understood that NO ONE can improvise a false story that absolutely matches the physical evidence when interrogated at the scene. There are almost ALWAYS serious inconsistencies that cause them to begin to re-build their story again and again until the entire thing unravels. Now if you DELAY the interrogation then they might be able to pull something together, but something like this, with an on scene and later interrogation that while narrated in slightly different words matched the previous interrogation completely in every factual manner . . . Frankly Zimmerman doesn't strike me as being nearly that clever, or the kind of a person who'd have the guts to LET someone get in close and repeatedly beat him just to justify a shooting.
